text: Shelopugino () is a rural locality (a selo) and the administrative center of Shelopuginsky District of Zabaykalsky Krai, Russia. Population: ==Geography== The village is about 462 km southeast of the regional capital Chita and 72 km from the nearest railway station. It is on the bank of the Unda River. There is a Museum of Local History.Shelopugino in the Encyclopedia Transbaikaliens (Russian) ==History== Shelopugino was first mentioned in 1782. A prison camp operated until 1917. In January 1930 the agricultural commune was formed, which united 11 villages or 900 peasant households, but by May it had ceased, and the residents joined the peasant uprising. Until the 1990s, the airport operated. ==References== Category:Rural localities in Zabaykalsky Krai
title: Shelopugino, Zabaykalsky Krai
